name: Wemby
slogan: Online therapy and mental health education for people and organisations
description:
Wemby offers a multi-language, online wellbeing service. Helping individuals to gain easy access to professional wellbeing advice overcoming location or language barriers. 
We strive to spread a culture of healthy living and preventive approach, compared to the responsive (once the problem is already there) of traditional healthcare. Currently focusing on wellbeig in the workplace, that's it, where you spend 60%-80% of your time.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Alberto Fantappie
team.bioHtml: Founder @Wemby • Worked at @Google, @Rocket Internet

jobs.title: Technical Lead
jobs.description:
:Hello world:

At Wemby we are looking for a great personality to become our Lead software engineer! 

We are looking for emphatic people who strive to have an impact and are thrilled by taking up new challenges.


Main responsibilities will include: 
-  Take over the current product (mobile app in Titanium + WebApp built in the MEAN stack, maintain AWS) and become quickly hands-on, making sure everything keeps working well
-  Wit the support of advisors when needed, improve the current product and architect the next version of the product and increasing the bar of Wemby's tech, 
- Contribute to Wemby’s growth and participate actively in cross-function decisions.
- Lead and coordinate a team of remote support developers

**WEMBY**
Our mission: to make effective mental health accessible, affordable and de-stigmatized for everyone around the world. A counselor in everyone’s pocket.
We are starting focusing on wellbeing in the workplace, where people spend 80% of their time. Especially, workers in challenging locations, and those who are putting their lives at risk to help others.


**About you:
**-	You are genuinely interested in helping people, and what drives you the most is the positive impact you can have on the lives of others.
-	1-2 years development experience, better if in a startup environment or fast-paced environment.
-	Solid knowledge of devops including AWS and GCP strongly appreciated
-	Good knowledge of latest chatbot technology, Ai, ML and data science
-	Tech you should know or be willing to learn: Javascript, Express, Node.js, Angular, Mongo DB, AWS, GSC, react, react native.
-	What you don't know you're ready to learn, and you're someone who learns quickly ☺
-	You are someone flexible and versatile who can thrive in uncertainity, and in a place were things change often and with little notice
-	You are comfortable taking responsability quickly, being accountable for your objectives, nurturing your team and work with little supervison
-	You deliver, you execute and you make it happen. If you need to dig a hole in a mountain and all you have is a spoon, you start digging until you have a better tool! ;) 


**WHAT WE OFFER**
You’ll be joining a startup with a validated product, traction, and entering growth phase. We are profitable in a super hot space, our clients love us and our uesers rate 4.8/5.

You will have the opportunity to grow as a tech leader, have impact across the whole organisation, our users and our clients.
You will interface with top advisors, academics and experts to develop Wemby's new cutting edge technology which will revolutionise how psychology is seen today.
Have an impact and help us change the world! Click Apply!

jobs.title: Right Hand of the CEO - intern
jobs.description:
As the right hand of the CEO, this internship is a unique opportunity to experience first-hand what building a start-up really is. You will be expected to make a substantial contribution to the team and learn while doing. 

Main responsibilities will include: 
•	Business development and lead generation: sourcing and following up on new clients, partners and new opportunities
*  Social Media: overseeing and planning Wemby's social media efforts to increase exposure and relevance in the digital health space
*  Costumer support: develop a deep knowledge of Wemby's product, develop support tools and provide direct support to therapist's, clients and users when needed
*  Analysis: analyse trends, competitve landscape, user feedback and make recommendations for improvements and product iterations
•	Other activities: market research, support in drafting documents, preparation of reports and industry benchmarks. 
You will have the opportunity to be involved in a wide array of tasks that could require you to interact with design, development other other teams .

Based on your skills and interests, you will be able to tailor your missions and take the lead on some activities. Learn and be challenged in a startup environment where your ideas will be heard and your work will have an impact.


YOU 
We’re looking for an outstanding business candidate who combines great communication and analytical skills. 

•	You are a self-starter who gets things done with minimum supervision and can execute in a fast-paced environment. 
•	You are a team player and last minute requests don’t scare you, you know they are part of the business.
•	You are bold, curious and not afraid to make mistakes, and if you do, you accept it and fix them. 
•	You learn quickly and can find your way through a maze following your instinct. You like to figure out how to solve problems and to improve things.
•	Ideally, you have done at least one internship in another startup, management consulting or top internet company.
•	You are passionate about wellbeing, personal development and entrepreneurship and one day you would like to set up your own company.
•	You have lived abroad, done some traveling and have some funny stories to share in front of a beer ☺
And most important of all, you get things done and make it happen!


WHAT WE OFFER
Paid min 6 months internship
An excellent opportunity to understand the making of a startup and working in a flat and laid back environment
Possibility of a longer engagement after the internship
Starting ASAP
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As the right hand of the CEO, this internship is a unique opportunity to experience first-hand what building a start-up really is. You will be expected to make a substantial contribution to the team and learn while doing.

Main responsibilities will include:
• Business development and lead generation: sourcing and following up on new clients, partners and new opportunities

  • Social Media: overseeing and planning Wemby's social media efforts to increase exposure and relevance in the digital health space
  • Costumer support: develop a deep knowledge of Wemby's product, develop support tools and provide direct support to therapist's, clients and users when needed
  • Analysis: analyse trends, competitve landscape, user feedback and make recommendations for improvements and product iterations • Other activities: market research, support in drafting documents, preparation of reports and industry benchmarks. You will have the opportunity to be involved in a wide array of tasks that could require you to interact with design, development other other teams .

Based on your skills and interests, you will be able to tailor your missions and take the lead on some activities. Learn and be challenged in a startup environment where your ideas will be heard and your work will have an impact.

YOU
We’re looking for an outstanding business candidate who combines great communication and analytical skills.

• You are a self-starter who gets things done with minimum supervision and can execute in a fast-paced environment.
• You are a team player and last minute requests don’t scare you, you know they are part of the business.
• You are bold, curious and not afraid to make mistakes, and if you do, you accept it and fix them.
• You learn quickly and can find your way through a maze following your instinct. You like to figure out how to solve problems and to improve things.
• Ideally, you have done at least one internship in another startup, management consulting or top internet company.
• You are passionate about wellbeing, personal development and entrepreneurship and one day you would like to set up your own company.
• You have lived abroad, done some traveling and have some funny stories to share in front of a beer ☺
And most important of all, you get things done and make it happen!

WHAT WE OFFER
Paid min 6 months internship
An excellent opportunity to understand the making of a startup and working in a flat and laid back environment
Possibility of a longer engagement after the internship
Starting ASAP

jobs.title: Online Psychologist - CBT
jobs.description:
Want to make a difference, with some of the most socially engaged people Do you want to make a difference without having to leave your home?  Here at Wemby, we are looking for a psychologist, to carry out interventions online, and provide that much-needed support to some of our most exposed patients: NGO workers and other humanitarian organizations.

We are looking for emphatic people to strive to have an impact. 

We work hard but also take breaks and have a good time ;-)  At Wemby we are about learning, doing and improving.


The Challenge
Provide online counseling to people working in remote and challenging locations. Often with disrupted schedules, high-pressure, being away from home for extended periods of time, and exposed to traumatic events.
You would be their point of reference at Wemby, and you will be able to manage the whole relationship through our app. That includes, providing video counseling sessions, answering their questions and messaging.

A few words about us, at Wemby
Our mission: to make effective mental health accessible, affordable and de-stigmatized for everyone around the world. To be a counselor in everyone’s pocket.
Our main focus to date is to support people’s wellbeing at their workplace, where we spend 80% of our time. This is especially the case for workers in challenging locations, and those who are putting their lives at risk to help others.


A few words about You:
-	You are genuinely interested in helping people, and what drives you the most is the positive impact you can have on others’ lives
-	You empathize, are ready to go the extra mile to help if required.
-	You hold a Bachelor/ Master’ degree in Clinical Psychology and are registered as a practicing psychologist by an accredited organization.
-	You have at least 2 years of proven (with references) clinical experience and are familiar and comfortable with cognitive behavioral therapy principles and experience (CBT).
-	You focus on the following areas: stress, anxiety, depression, trauma, addictions, post-traumatic stress disorders and secondary trauma 
-	You are at ease with technology and you have experience with online counseling sessions.
-	You are eager to learn new things and to contribute to Wemby’s psychologists’ community 
-	You have practiced therapy and are comfortable with providing them in at least one of the following languages: English, Spanish, and French
-	Volunteer/humanitarian experience is a plus

You commit to dedicating to us 10-20 hours/week. 


WHAT WE OFFER
A competitive remuneration according to market standards.
A closed knit team, highly motivated by a common purpose and engaged in social change.
An opportunity to work in a rising startup and to contribute to its growth and your growth with it.
A possibility to engage with us longer and more. 
Starting date, ASAP. 

We have a great opportunity ahead of us to make a difference to those away from home, in challenges environments to serve others themselves too. 


Apply here: https://wemby.typeform.com/to/MXCpAS

Apply here: https://wemby.typeform.com/to/MXCpAS

jobs.title: TERAPEUTA EN LÍNEA VOLUNTARIO (TCC) – RESPUESTA COVID-19 ESPAÑA
jobs.description:
¿Deseas hacer la diferencia y contribuir en estos tiempos desafiantes? Aquí, en Wemby, buscamos psicólogos para intervención el línea como voluntarios para proveer aquel apoyo tan necesario al personal médico que trabaja en la crisis del COVID-19.
#Yomequedoencasa, pero además, hago algo!!
En Wemby, estamos buscando psicólogos que puedan dar sus servicios a través de sesiones virtuales, y apoyar a los que más lo necesitan, es decir, al personal médico y sanitario que trabaja en la crisis del COVID-19.
Buscamos individuos empáticos que deseen influir y usar sus habilidades para aliviar a aquellos en las primeras líneas.
Buscamos personas empáticas que quieran trabajar y contribuir voluntariamente usando sus conocimientos, habilidades y experiencia para aliviar al personal médico que está en la primera línea de batalla contra el COVID-19.  

Wemby es una startup de tele-psicología que atiende al colectivo médico de manera regular, especialmente a aquellos que están realizando labores humanitarias. Queremos poner nuestras herramientas y nuestra experiencia para apoyar también en esta crisis, más cercana que nunca.   

El desafío:
El reto 
-	Proporcionar terapia en línea a individuos que trabajen en hospitales, centros de atención o que participen en la respuesta a la crisis del COVID.
-	Una vez que tu paciente te haya sido asignado a través de nuestra aplicación, te convertirás en el punto de referencia del usuario.
-	Responder a preguntas a través del sistema de mensajes de Wemby y proporcionar sesiones de terapia por video llamada.

-	Proporcionar sesiones de psicoterapia de apoyo, totalmente gratuitamente, al personal médico y sanitario que trabaja en hospitales de la red pública o privada, centros ambulatorios y otros, que participan en la atención a personas afectadas por el COVID-19.

-	Cada profesional médico y sanitario será asignado a un terapeuta a través de nuestra aplicación y tú, como terapeuta, serás el punto de referencia para este profesional. 

-	Los terapeutas deberán responder a las preguntas que los profesionales médicos y sanitarios les hagan a través del sistema de mensajes de Wemby y estar disponibles para sesiones de terapia de apoyo a distancia a través de video llamada en nuestra propia aplicación. 

WEMBY:
Nuestra misión: lograr que la salud mental efectiva sea asequible, económica y sin estigma para todos alrededor del mundo. Un terapeuta en cada bolsillo.
Ponemos a disposición nuestra infraestructura y recursos técnicos en servicio para apoyo sin costo para ofrecer ayuda durante la crisis.

Unas palabras sobre nosotros, en Wemby 
Nuestra misión es hacer que la salud mental sea accesible económica y materialmente hablando y sin tapujos, a todos, en todo el mundo. Un terapeuta en cada bolsillo. Desde Wemby ponemos de forma totalmente gratuita, nuestra infrastructura, experiencia, y recursos técnicos al servicio de los profesionales sanitarios que en esta crisis lo necesitan más que nunca. 


Acerca de ti:
-	Estás honestamente interesado en ayudar a otros, y lo que te mueve más es el impacto positivo que puedas tener sobre la vida de tus usuarios.
-	Empatizas con tus usuarios y estás listo para esforzarte para ayudarlos, si es necesario.
-	Tienes una licenciatura o una maestría en Psicología clínica y tienes una cédula profesional o estás registrado como psicólogo profesional por alguna organización reconocida por tu país.
-	Tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia clínica comprobada (con referencias) ayudando a usuarios y usando terapia cognitivo conductual (TCC).
-	Tienes experiencia en respuesta a crisis y terapia de emergencia.
-	Estás familiarizado con la tecnología y tienes experiencia con sesiones en línea.
-	Estás dispuesto a ofrecer sesiones sin costo a personal médico y de servicios de emergencia.
-	Dominas el español y puedes dar terapia en español.

Unas palabras sobre ti
-	Disfrutas ayudando a otras personas, teniendo un impacto positivo en sus vidas
-	Eres una persona empática y estás dispuesto/a a dar el resto por ayudar, si fuera necesario
-	Has estudiado psicología clínica o tienes un máster en la materia y estás colegiado 
-	Tienes al menos dos años de experiencia y puedes proporcionar cartas de referencia al respecto, y estás familiarizado/a con las técnicas y principios de terapia cognitivo conductuales (CBT en su acrónimo en inglés). 
-	Si además tienes experiencia en terapias en situaciones extremas, o de urgencia, mejor.  
-	Te sientes cómodo/a con la tecnología y tienes experiencia con sesiones virtuales de psicoterapia de apoyo.
-	Estás dispuesto a poner tu conocimiento y experiencia gratuitamente al servicio del personal médico y sanitario durante esta crisis. 
-	Dominas el español y estás capacitado/a para dar terapia de apoyo en español. 
-	
Si has leído este mensaje y conoces a alguien a quien le pueda interesar, no dudes en compartirlo! 


Compromiso: de 5 a 10 horas a la semana, con bastante flexibilidad, dadas las circunstancias, y empezando lo antes posible.

Por favor, presenta tu solicitud aquí: https://forms.gle/ByYjJGbHMW5oLoiL7

  • Tienes una licenciatura o una maestría en Psicología clínica y tienes una cédula profesional o estás registrado como psicólogo profesional por alguna organización reconocida por tu país.
